title: "Dark Horse" picks
body:
What else could riot suddenly make a thing by advertising it as a "Dark Horse?" I remember a game a long time ago where someone wanted to take Urgot mid (or Urgot in general for that matter), and they got flamed to oblivion. Same for J4 top or mid. Now these are things that people are ok with because Riot snapped their magic fingers and said "It's a thing now" Doesn't it make you wonder what else could be in the meta if people gave it a chance to be? It takes people to experiment with out of meta picks to find they fit into the meta. That's what riot is trying to do, but the average players are too afraid and judgemental to be that innovative of their own accord, until the pros do it, or Riot advertises it.

(Obligatory {{champion:17}} mention)

I have played Taric Top/Jg since ages ago, to pretty good sucess. Also Poppy jg. 

But taric top is such an awesome thing when you fight an all AD toplaner like Riven.

But people flamed me because Taric. However from my point of view, people are way more relaxed about that that years ago in S3, when people literally flammed you because you picked Malphite jungle.

How do you deal with how mana starved {{champion:44}}  is?

What's your build path for top? I generally first grab a {{item:3024}}  against AD.

My build path usually depends on who I am fighting, but {{item:3024}} is a pretty good thing. Also, the biggest mistake people do is to spam the Q heal that has a gigantical mana cost. Use mainly W and E for hits and runs. Potions for both health and mana are good earlygame, specially since health potions are better that the Q heal unless the situation calls for it (like surviving an ignite). 

Taric, is, ironically, a lot like Riven when it comes to passive mana**gem**ent, as you need to use your passive the best way possible to raise your damage to a decent place. Also good passive management makes you have a pretty low cd stun!

{{item:3025}} is an awesome item for Taric. Also, despite everything, {{item:3028}} is still good and both its upgrades are decent, with {{item:3222}} giving more MR and {{item:3174}} giving more CDR and damage, even on Taric top. {{item:3110}} , {{item:3800}}  and {{item:3512}}  are also awesome. {{item:3075}} will always be awesome. Basically everything with Armor and/or Health is good on Taric. {{item:3068}} and {{item:3143}}, with {{item:3065}} and {{item:3102}} being pretty good for different reasons.

Since Taric with his kit plus {{item:3025}} is dealing mixed damage, something like {{item:3153}} and {{item:3157}} are good too! More AP means you are more bursty, while most AD items give you better sustained damage thanks to lifesteal and more AD/AS/ArPen that interacts with Shatter's debuff.

basically, I start with {{item:1054}} against magic/mixed damage and {{item:1029}} 3  {{item:2003}} 2 {{item:2004}} against pure AD like {{champion:114}} and {{champion:92}} .
What about RoA?

Roa could work, as it gives basically of everything that you could need, and can work well with chalice and Zz'rot thanks to the mixed defenses and bigger mana pool. Heck, if you are going IG, RoA, FH you could also go with Mikael's and Muramana if you want to.
Do you just do standard toplane runes or anything special for taric like flat mana?
Hybrid Pen Marks, Armor Yellows, MR Blues and Armor quints.

Okay. I'll explain it like this.{{item:3100}} {{item:3057}} 

Lich Banes Passive is granting addional attack damage after using a Skill. Yes this item works on other mages as well, but it's not the point. The point is that Sona works very very well with this item, because Sona also works well with cooldown reduction causing her to have very low cooldowns. Let me mention here, that even without additional cdr her cds are not that high.
Sonas Trades don't end with either her Q or her powerchord, because she can still do additional damage due to Lich Bane on almost every AA, if you time it right.
And honestly? How much damage does Diana do with her Q at lvl 1? We are not talking about what happens at level 1, because usually nothing happens at that level. Everyone tries to out-cs their lane-opponent so they get to lvl 2 first. Also no one has a Lich Bane, or even a Sheen at lvl 1 (Remember ARAM starts at lv3).

Sona often reaches the point in game, where she can continually spam her  q w e without much of a brake in it. So she goes: q, aa, w, aa, e, aa, q, aa .... and so on, once in a while triggering her Ult. In Addition to that you might get a Powerchord, that is empowered by using Q before and the Lichbane. And this does a lot of damage. (as does her q in generall)

Did you never wonder why people kept banning Sona in URF? It's not only because of her heal, I can tell you that much. Other champions can heal as well...

Another strength of Sonas by the way is her low Skill-Level. She has no skillshots (Her Ult is so big that is qualifies as a Skill-Wave but not a "shot") and she doesn't have any point and klick skills. Only Skill-Activation and Auto-Attack. This makes her especially effective, because it doesn't allow for dodges.

By the way Diana, TF and Fizz build Lich Bane because they have to AA due to their skills/passives anyways. The Item does well on them too, but for different reasons.
To be honest the best comparison of Sona -Lich Bane synergy that comes to my mind is Irelia - Trinity Force.

People need to stop playing "Dark Horse" picks unless they can back up the fact that they are good and "No, ADC Lulu is totally a thing. I swear." Next thing you know, they get into lane and feed harder than a first-timer, and you just wasted 45 minutes to one hour of my life, as well as the lives of 4 other people. I myself hate this especially because I usually don't get to play that many games of league in a day because I have college classes to attend, a job to show up for, and projects to do outside of the class room. Then I play league for at least some entertainment value, but someone makes things less fun for me, turning was was a game into a stomping. And that's not fun. That's just plain frustrating.

Also, for those of you who say you shouldn't play league for entertainment, I'd invite you to rethink your definition of what a "game" is.

In other words, don't go full AP Tryndamere in the support role is not just an off meta pick, its stupid.  Off meta picks need to have some thought put into how to build and how to play the role to succeed.

That being said, adc lulu wouldn't be that bad.  I can't see it ever being quite as good as using a traditional adc, but I don't think it is much worse.  Still, you probably shouldn't get mad about off meta picks when it was very likely just a bad game for the person (or they were just bad), rather then because of their champion and role choice.

If you think about why the meta is the way it is (mage needs levels -> solo lane, adc needs gold and could use help farming -> duo lane) doesn't really make sense for a lot of champions.  Plenty of ADC's are not only self sufficient in solo lanes, but scale heavily on levels and can bully their opponents pretty hard.  And some mages have weak early games and are very gold dependent.

My problem is when the person doesn't actually know what they're doing, and it's obvious. If you can't last until either jungler have finished their first clear without giving first blood to the enemy, something is wrong.

Which really has nothing to do with picking off meta.  Playing the meta still does not mean you know what your doing.  In fact, blindly following the meta without knowing why probably makes you less likely to know what you need to do.  For example, the reason every team pretty much needs a marksmen is to be able to take down towers in a siege.  The marksmen needs to know this in order to do what needs to be done.

Yes, it doesn't really matter if you're playing Xerath mid or tank Akali jungle, if you don't know what you're doing, you're wasting an hour of everyone on your team's life.

However. If you are going to break the meta, I feel that the responsibility of justifying your choice is also a factor. If you're doing something off-the-wall, you better know what you're doing, if not for all we know you're just trolling. I had someone who tried to carry as Nunu in ranked. Everyone has to trust him that he knows what he's doing, and when he fails so hard that we don't even make it to 20 minutes to surrender, there's bound to be a lot of skepticism, and he's probably going to get reported. Honestly, how would you feel if you've never heard of ADC lulu, doesn't see how the role connects with the champion, and she loses the game? Don't you think that Lulu was the problem in that case? You can't tell me if you were to see someone play something like... Sona adc or something, you wouldn't skeptical and most likely judge that person's playing a bit more harshly. Right?

I know most of the champion kits relatively well, so I can see how Lulu adc or Sona adc would work.  At the same time I don't see a very big reason to try to use them over the more traditional adcs.  I do get mad when someone just does something stupid in the name of being off-meta.  My definition of stupid is like going AP Tryndamere.  There is literally no reason to do it.  Most ranged champions can work alright as adc.  And if switching from AD to AP, or AP to AD works with the kit, then I am fine with it.  For example, AP Varus can destroy tanks.  Also, building champions normally but taking them to a different lane than usual can be very smart.

If someone takes an off-meta pick into a ranked game and builds it smart but does poorly, I may be annoyed that they did not practice it more, but I am not going to report for intentional feeding because of the champion choice.
